intro: Chomelia conferta, commonly known as the clustered chomelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically ovate or elliptical, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Chomelia conferta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
